data.title: Texas A&M Athletics
data.meta_description: Lexi Lopez (27) Setter - 2016 (FRESHMAN) Made her A&M debut and only appearance of the season late in the third set at UTEP and had an ace and an assist in t...
data.text:
2016 (FRESHMAN)

Made her A&M debut and only appearance of the season late in the third set at UTEP and had an ace and an assist in the first two plays of her career…Completed the sweep against the Miners with five assists after setting up freshman middle blocker Maddie Douglas for the match-winning kill.

PREVIOUS ATHLETIC EXPERIENCE

Was a four-year starting setter for coach Kelly McCarter at Vandegrift High School…A two-time selection to the Texas Girls Coaches Association Class 5A all-state team (2014-15)…As a senior, was named to the AVCA Under Armour Watch List…Capped her prep career by leading the Vipers to the state tournament regional semifinals and a 40-10 record, a school record for wins…Was a three-time member of the District 25-5A all-district first team, earning district Setter of the Year honors in 2013 and 2015…Also was a three-time member of the academic all-district team…Played club ball for AJV Mizuno (12s-18s) and was teammates with future Aggie teammate Maddie Douglas…Named to PrepVolleyball.com’s 2015 High School All-Americans Special Mention list…Was a candidate for PrepVolleyball.com’s Andi Collins Award, recognizing the top high school senior setter in the nation…Most memorable moment of athletic career is beating high school rival Cedar Park for the first time in school history.

PERSONAL

Alexandra Madison Lopez is the daughter of Zandra Lopez…Began playing volleyball when she was 8 years old…Only official recruiting visit was to Texas A&M…Chose to attend Texas A&M because, “I loved how passionate the students, faculty/staff and coaches were about the traditions. I had never visited a school that was so friendly, let alone a school that treated every one of their peers like family. The atmosphere, as well as the beautiful campus, ultimately sold me on A&M.”…Most memorable moment of Texas A&M athletic career is setting her first assist to longtime teammate and friend Maddie Douglas…Hobbies include drawing, reading and painting…Volunteered for The Big Event, the largest one-day, student-run service project in the nation in which Aggies assist residents within the community…Also participated in Aggies Read, an outreach organization that is dedicated to promoting literacy and fostering a love of reading for elementary and middle school students in the community…Is majoring in biology…Career ambition is to be a clinical neuropsychologist…Born March 3, 1998, in Alamosa, Colorado.

LOPEZ UP CLOSE

Favorites:

Favorite class subject: Psychology

Favorite quote: “I’m a great believer in luck, and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.” – Thomas Jefferson

Favorite volleyball player of all time: Alisha Glass

Favorite athlete (any sport): Christian Laettner or Zlatan Ibrahimovic

Favorite professional sports team (any sport): Real Madrid

Favorite social media site: Snapchat

Favorite emoji: Laughing emoji

Favorite type of music: Country

Favorite food: Steak

Favorite binge watching TV show: Criminal Minds

Favorite book: Paper Towns by John Green

Favorite movie: The Dark Knight

Favorite Disney character: Meg from Hercules

Favorite animal: Sloth

Favorite part about the sport of volleyball: Competing with my friends and winning

Favorite sport to play other than volleyball: Soccer

Favorite thing about A&M: The people

Favorite Aggie tradition: Aggie Muster

Favorite Karaoke song to sing: Wide Open Spaces

Favorite place to go: My room

Miscellaneous Questions:

My nickname is: Lex

One word to describe me when I’m on the court: Intense

One word to describe me away from the court: Chill

The person who has had the greatest impact on my athletic career: My mom

The accomplishment (athletic or non-athletic) that I am most proud of: Committing to A&M

The Aggie volleyball player I most idolized while growing up: Kristen (Schevikhoven) Grimes

The person I would most like to meet: Henry Cavill

People have told me that I look like (name of celebrity): Mila Kunis

The most famous athlete I have met: Serena Williams

The most famous non-athlete I have met: Vance Joy

The song title that best describes me: Just a Girl by Lady Antebellum

Best pump-up song: We Get Turnt Up

Musical instruments that I play: little piano, little guitar

Languages (other than English) that I speak fluently are: Spanish

When I was little, I dreamed of being an: Archaeologist

Early bird or night owl: Both

The reality show I would most like to participate in is: Chopped

I can’t believe I watch this show: The Real Husbands of Hollywood

Few people know that I: Snort when I laugh

My best non-athletic talent: Drawing

My most prized possession: My vintage cameras

My most annoying habit: Biting my nails

My pet peeve(s): when people smack their gum and when people don’t finish their sentences

My superstitions: I have to wear the same wristbands every match

If I had a million dollars, I would: buy a lot of cake, build my mom a house, vacation and save the rest

Three things on my bucket list are:

Go to Fiji

Sail the Greek Islands

Find a cure for a neurodegenerative disease

Being at A&M has taught me: To be more trusting and be more comfortable asking for help

Best piece of advice for your freshmen teammates: Use all of the amazing resources A&M has to offer

After I graduate, I plan to: Hopefully go to med or law school, I haven’t really decided yet

My dream job is: Financially secure artist

I am most thankful for: My family and friends

Teammate who:

The teammate who will surprise people the most this year: Houser

The teammate who can always make me laugh: Elli

The teammate who dominates in the weight room: Kiara… she can bench 2 of me

Teammate most likely to be on People’s “Best Dressed” list: Hollann

Teammate most likely to become president: Please don’t ever vote any one of us president… we’re weird.

Teammate who would be the best candidate for:

America’s Next Top Model: Blake (even though she’d probably hate it)

The Amazing Race: Maddie

The Apprentice: Houser

Big Brother: Gabby

Cake Wars: Hollann

Chopped: Me because I’m obsessed with this show

Fear Factor: Elli

Flip or Flop: Maddie because she is obsessed with the show and interior design

Jeopardy: Me because I know random weird facts

Impractical Jokers: Gabby

Last Comic Standing: Elli

The Price is Right: Haley

Shark Tank: Houser

So You Think You Can Dance: Kiara

Survivor: Kiara

The Voice: Maddie

Wheel of Fortune: Amy Nettles

Wipeout: Kiana- I’ve never seen anyone else fall out of a back extension machine… so I’m sure she’d be great

???????Corbelli imitation contest: Amy Nettles
